<url>http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif</url> </image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;366cf59c.1503">   <title>Philosophy of Information and Information Processing, March 27, Oxford - Program and Registration Details </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;366cf59c.1503</link>   <description> Philosophy of Information and Information Processing<br>Friday, March 27, Pembroke College, Oxford, UK<br><br>Provisional program for the Info-Metrics conference on Philosophy of Information and Information Processing (PIIP) is attached.<br><br>The program is available online at<br>http://www.american.edu/cas/economics/info-metrics/pdf/upload/Oxford-Workshop-Program.pdf<br><br>Registration is still open. For information is available at<br>https://adobeformscentral.com/?f=plSOWeV3LplRXrtKyXEBWw#<br><br>For conference web page and information see<br><br>http://www.american.edu/cas/economics/info-metrics/workshop/workshop-2015-spring.cfm<br><br>For further inquires please contact info-metrics@american.edu or look at our Web page at<br>http://www.american.edu/info-metrics [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-06T07:26:27+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alastair Hall</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;366cf59c.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;30849a9.1502">   <title>Registration is open: 8th Annual Society for Financial Econometrics (SoFiE) Conference on 24-26 June 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;30849a9.1502</link>   <description> The 8th Annual SoFiE Conference will be held at Aarhus University&lt;http://www.au.dk/en/&gt; on 24-26 June 2015. A pre-conference for junior researchers will be arranged on 23 June 2015.<br><br>The conference is hosted by CREATES (Center for Research in Econometric Analysis of Time Series); an institutional member of SoFiE.<br><br>Please visit the conference website for further information and registration. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T12:24:48+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Solveig Nygaard S\ufffd\ufffdrensen</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;30849a9.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;b84c8737.1502">   <title>SUMMER SCHOOL IN \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdECONOMETRICS FOR PROGRAM EVALUATION", Florence, 17-22 May 2015</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;b84c8737.1502</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br><br>I am pleased to announce that Tstat \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd the Italian supplier of Stata - is<br>organizing the following school on 17-22 May:<br><br>*SUMMER SCHOOL IN \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdECONOMETRICS FOR PROGRAM EVALUATION: THEORY AND PRACTICE<br>USING STATA\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd*<br><br>*Florence, 17-22 May 2015 *<br><br>Instructors:<br><br>*Kit Baum*, Boston College<br><br>*Giovanni Cerulli*, CNR-IRCrES<br><br>All information about this event are available here:<br>http://www.tstat.it/novita/conferenze/Summer_School_2015.htm<br><br>Please, circulate this news among interested people and in your network. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-17T11:04:11+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Giovanni Cerulli</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;b84c8737.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;faa38ebb.1502">   <title>Final call for abstracts @ CEF2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;faa38ebb.1502</link>   <description> *Final call for abstracts @ CEF2015*<br><br>*Deadline is here!*<br><br>Please make sure that you submit your abstracts for the general<br>submissions, organized sessions and student contest as soon as possible.<br>You can access the submissions page here:<br><br>http://www.aiecon.org/conference/cef2015/submission.htm<br><br>Do let us know if you face any difficulty while submitting the abstracts by<br>sending an email toaiecon.center@gmail.com<br><br>Note that the submissions page will not close immediately after the<br>deadline, but will remain open for a short while to allow people who might<br>have faced difficulty to submit abstracts. However*, we urge you to<br>complete your submissions as soon as possible. *   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-15T19:46:13+08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Selda Kao</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;faa38ebb.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;3671b2f5.1502">   <title>SmartPLS 3.0 Online Webinar </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;3671b2f5.1502</link>   <description> Visit: http://tinyurl.com/smartpls30 Registration costs $175 USD for faculty and $125 for full-time students. Learn &quot;hands-on&quot; PLS path modeling using the newest SmartPLS Professional version software taught by an expert. Live, online, 2-day webinar featuring SmartPLS 3.1.9 Pro. 2,500 SmartPLS citations in academic journals over past decade. Participants receive: a certificate; a 30-day SmartPLS 3.1.9 professional license; a PLS-GUI SaaS license active thru 2015; all demonstrated files, data, models and projects, and slides; and complete HD audio and video recordings of the completed webinar. Geoff Hubona   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-11T08:42:00-07:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Geoffrey Hubona</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;3671b2f5.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;92b4290b.1502">   <title>CEF2015 - Abstract Submissions deadline is near!!! </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;92b4290b.1502</link>   <description> *CEF 2015, June 20-22, 2015, Taipei, Taiwan*<br><br>Society for Computational Economics<br>21st International Conference on Computing in Economics and Finance<br><br>*Abstract Submissions deadline is near!!!*<br><br>*Organized Sessions: **(Deadline: Feb 16 2015)*<br><br>CEF 2015 will have organized sessions on the following topics. More details<br>here! &lt;http://www.aiecon.org/conference/cef2015/organized_sessions.htm&gt;.<br><br>1. Agent-Based Macro Models - (Organizer: Cars Hommes)<br>2. Laboratory Experiments - (Organizer: Cars Hommes)<br>3. Expectations and Learning - (Organizer: Cars Hommes)<br>4. The Cross-Strait: Computational and Behavioral Approach to Economics<br>- (Organizer: Wei-Xing Zhou)<br>5. Quantitative Finance - (Organizer: Carl Chiarella)<br>6. Theory of Heterogeneous Agents - (Organizer: Carl Chiarella)<br>7. Modelling Economic [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-10T10:06:26+08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Selda Kao</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;92b4290b.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;62df6f4d.1502">   <title>University of Liverpool Annual Econometrics Workshop 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;62df6f4d.1502</link>   <description> University of Liverpool Annual Econometrics Workshop 2015<br><br>I am pleased to announce that University of Liverpool Annual Econometrics Workshop will take place on Friday 27th March 2015. The list of speakers and the complete workshop programme can be found at the end of this announcement.<br><br>As in the past, we aim to offer free participation of the workshop sessions as well as the workshop dinner. However, for catering purpose, please confirm you intention to participate and in particular state whether or not you wish to join the workshop dinner by emailing myself at ruijunbu@liv.ac.uk<mailto:ruijunbu@liv.ac.uk> before 15th March at the very [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T14:18:26+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Bu, Ruijun</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;62df6f4d.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;135b9dd2.1502">   <title>Call-for-paper - IWcee15, Rome, 28-29 May 2015 - IRCrES-CNR, Deadline for abstract: April 1, 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;135b9dd2.1502</link>   <description> Dear Colleague,<br><br>It is a pleasure to announce the call-for-paper (abstract first) for<br>participating to the *\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdIWcee15 - International Workshop on Computational<br>Economics and Econometrics\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd* that will be held in *Rome, **May 28-29, 2015* at<br>the National Research Council of Italy.<br><br>IWcee15 main topic this year will be:<br><br>*\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdThe Complexity of Economics and the Economics of Complexity\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd* [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-05T15:38:01+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Giovanni Cerulli</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;135b9dd2.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;9330b0ba.1502">   <title>Call for Abstract - International Conference of Computing in Economics and Finance </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;9330b0ba.1502</link>   <description> ---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: AI-ECON RESEARCH CENTER &lt;aiecon.center@gmail.com&gt;<br>Date: 4 February 2015 at 09:30<br>Subject: Fwd: CEF 2015 - Student Contest, Organized sessions and Workshops<br>To: Selda Kao &lt;seldakao@gmail.com&gt;<br><br>---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: AI-ECON RESEARCH CENTER &lt;aiecon.center@gmail.com&gt;<br>Date: Mon, Feb 2, 2015 at 9:39 AM<br>Subject: CEF 2015 - Student Contest, Organized sessions and Workshops<br>To:<br><br>*CEF 2015, June 20-22, 2015, Taipei, Taiwan* [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-04T09:47:35+08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Selda Kao</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;9330b0ba.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;13e39457.1502">   <title>Earn 3 PhD Quantitative Grad Credits online this summer </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;13e39457.1502</link>   <description> Earn 3 graduate credits online this summer applicable to many Master's and PhD programs in Europe and elsewhere. The course presents a comprehensive overview of the most modern statistical, multivariate, SEM and Path Modeling techniques used today in research data analyses. Successful participants receive a 3-graduate-credit certificate issued by the Hamburg University of Technology (TUHH), a premier University in the EUC. Very early registrants have access to a very limited number of spaces that are offered to anyone (students, faculty, or practitioners) for $595 USD total with a deposit of $150. This live, interactive, online course will be conducted during [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T05:01:41-07:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Geoffrey Hubona</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;13e39457.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;b4a45b31.1502">   <title>Int. Conf. on Policy Implications of Systemic Risk Models & Measures - Amsterdam, 4/5 june 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;b4a45b31.1502</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>(Please forward this call to anyone interested)<br><br>Andre Lucas, Dirk Schoenmaker, Arjen Siegmann and Siem Jan Koopman are organizing the conference below June 4-5 in Amsterdam. Invited speakers include Goodhart, Manganelli, and Peydro. We welcome your participation and/or your paper submission. Registering can be done by mailing to SYRTO.conference@vu.nl. Also papers can be submitted there before the deadline. Conference fee will be limited to covering the conference dinner costs thanks to sponsorship by the EU FP7. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T10:55:41+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Charles Bos</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;b4a45b31.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;cf8c1dc.1502">   <title>Webinar: 3 Ways to Improve your Regression </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;cf8c1dc.1502</link>   <description> Webinar: 3 Ways to Improve your Regression<br><br>Date/Time: February 10, 2015 from 10am-11am PDT<br><br>* If inconvenient time, please register and we will send you a recording.<br><br>Click to Register:<br>http://hubs.ly/y0v5s00&lt;https://app.getsignals.com/link?url=http%3a%2f%2fhubs.ly%2fy0v5s00&amp;ukey=agxzfnNpZ25hbHNjcnhyGAsSC1VzZXJQcm9maWxlGICAgMCxqZwIDA&amp;k=f47cf77d14ef4d59b45ef61ac2cf6430&gt;<br>Abstract:<br><br>* Linear regression plays a big part in the everyday life of a data analyst, but the results are not always satisfactory. What if you could drastically improve prediction accuracy in your regression with a new model that handles missing values, interactions, AND nonlinearities in your data? [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-02T12:51:27-06:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Lisa Solomon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;cf8c1dc.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;c1defb47.1501">   <title>Call for Papers: Improving productivity in developing countries: identifying bottlenecks and obstacles to productive investments and technology adoption </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;c1defb47.1501</link>   <description> *Improving productivity in developing countries: identifying bottlenecks<br>and obstacles to productive investments and technology adoption<br>&lt;http://www.ifs.org.uk/events/1100&gt;*<br><br>*8 and 9 July 2015,* Goodenough College London.<br><br>/Organised by: Orazio Attanasio (UCL and IFS), Britta Augsburg (IFS),<br>Safija Jusupovic (IFS) and Sonya Krutikova (IFS)<br>/<br>*/CALL FOR PAPERS NOW OPEN/*<br><br>The call for papers is now open and will close of*28^th ****of February<br>2015*and notifications of acceptances will be circulated by April 17^th<br>2015.*//* [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-29T11:08:16+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>IFS Events</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;c1defb47.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;e3dff04f.1501">   <title>Comprehensive live, online SEM training using R packages </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;e3dff04f.1501</link>   <description> Learn to conduct live "hands-on" SEM analyses using the popular R lavaan package in 8 online weekly sessions. Optionally choose a concurrent registration in Multilevel Modeling with the xxM package or in SIMulated SEM with the popular R SIMSEM package. Financial aid is available in the form of no-interest 6-month loans. Participants receive: (1) a Certificate of Participation; (2) all in-class examples, R scripts, slides, and any other class materials or content demonstrated in the live sessions; and (3) complete HD audio and video recordings of all live sessions to download for unlimited review of all content, demonstrated examples and [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-27T13:20:08-07:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Geoffrey Hubona</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;e3dff04f.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;e502e8db.1501">   <title>Organized Sessions - Call for Abstracts - CEF 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ECONOMETRIC-RESEARCH;e502e8db.1501</link>   <description> *Organized Sessions - Call for Abstracts - CEF 2015*<br><br>Society for Computational Economics<br><br>21st International Conference on Computing in Economics and Finance<br><br>June 20-22, 2015, Taipei, Taiwan<br>*Organized Session submissions - open now!*<br><br>CEF 2015 will have organized sessions on the following topics. Deadline for<br>abstract submission: 16 Feb 2015.<br><br>More details are now available on our website<br>&lt;http://www.aiecon.org/conference/cef2015/organized_sessions.htm&gt;. But there are many other useful signals in text:<br>emotion, intent, speculation, risk, etc. This talk will present a survey of relevant techniques and the state of the art in recognising these other dimensions of sentiment in text and describe some practical and some potential applications in finance and elsewhere. Visit: http://tinyurl.com/mybayesian Live, online, interactive 8-session course begins January 22 with AM and PM sessions to reach everyone. HD audio and video recordings of live workshop sessions provided to all participants afterwards. Learn to conduct: Prediction; Dealing with proportions; Discrete priors; Beta priors; Single-parameter, normally distributed models with known means and unknown variance; Bayesian robustness; Mixtures of conjugate priors; Multi-parameter models: Normal data with 2 unknown parameters; Multinomial models; Comparing two proportions; Bayesian computation: Computing integrals; Monte carlo simulation. Hierarchical modeling: Model comparisons; Comparing hypotheses.
